39049642.review:
Back to the Future: The Game is a fine addition to the classic Back to the Future story line. The story starts off fairly straight-forward, but then things get complicated as Marty and Doc go through the adventure. In true likeness to the original movies, nothing is ever simple when it comes to time travel, and simple events create great waves in the timeline.

The gameplay itself is that of a point-and-click adventure, with lots of talking to characters and using items to solve various situations. The puzzles are certainly not arbitrary like the past games, and most things can be figured out with a little bit of thought. But if you are ever stuck, there is an in-game hint system to help you move along and advance the story.

This title is certainly one that Back to the Future fans can appreciate. Even if you aren't a die-hard fan of the old films, there is still a fun story to be experienced here, and it may make a fan of you yet.

7/10 "Good"

39009946.review:
Since Steam splits every episode of Back to the Future into a separate store page, unlike newer Telltale games, I'm just putting my review for the entire game here.

A phenomenal adventure game that not only features great puzzles, but is driven by a funny, heatwarming story and incredible acting. It's the best sequel that Back to the Future has ever managed to produce, and made me genuinely care about the original movie even more.

No se puede decir que sea un juego dificil, ya que es un point & click y no tiene mucho misterio, como Telltale Games nos tiene acostumbrados.

38113116.review:
[b]TO RECENZJA CAŁEJ GRY, NIE POSZCZEGÓLNYCH EPIZODÓW
THIS IS A WHOLE GAME REVIEW, NOT THE SEPERATE EPIZODES[/b]

[b]PL[/b]
Świetna gra na podstawie filmu o tym samym tytule. Przygoda rozciąga się na 5 epizodów, po ok. 3h każdy.
Mamy tutaj wiele postaci z oryginalnego filmu, jak np Marty, Doc (Dr Brown), dziewczyna i rodzice głównego bohatera.
Większość akcji gry, jak również epizodów dzieje się w małym, choć dobrze odwzorowanym miasteczku z filmu.
Mamy liniową fabułę, jak również nagłe zwroty akcji, zagadki na koniec każdego epizodu, oraz zabawne teksty, gagi.
Grę cechuje poziom grafiki typowej dla gier spod znaku TellTaleGames, więc jest ona raczej kreskówkowa niż rzeczywista.
Myślę, że Back to the Future nadaje się dla każdego, nie ma w niej przemocy, wulgaryzmów, a jedynie dobra zabawa.

[b]EN[/b]
A great game based on a movie with the same title. The adventure extends to 5 episodes, with about 3 hours each.
Here we have many characters from the original movie, such as Marty, Doc (Dr Brown), a girlfriend and parents of the main character.
Most of the game's action, as well as episodes happen in a small, well-reproduced from a movie town, though.
We have a linear plot, as well as sudden twists, puzzles at the end of each episode, and joked texts, gags.
The game is characterized by the level of graphics typical for TellTaleGames games, so it's rather cartoonish than real.
I think that Back to the Future is good game for everyone, there is no violence, no vulgarisms, just the fun.

33917505.review:
This is one of the less memorable Telltale games for me, with The Walking Dead, Tales from the Borderlands, and Sam & Max being the ones the really stand out and I had a nice time with. I also remember Telltale's Jurassic Park game, but not for good reasons. In any case, I did like Telltale's Back to the Future game. It's not amazing, but it has some cute moments, a variety of time periods to keep things fresh enough, and some good voicework.

If the Back to the Future films aren't something you love, then the game might has less value for you, and even if you do love them, you can probably pass on this game unless it's really eating at you to play it, but they did a good job and I over all had a nice time here.

33782998.review:
[quote=]
 [h1] Продолжение моего эпизодического обзора! Ха, не только Telltale так умеют!   [/h1]

В этот раз мы снова отправляемся в прошлое, что бы отменить временную линию, в которой Хилл-Вэлли превратился в диктаторскую утопию под руководством гражданина Брауна. И для этого нам попросту нужно поссорить молодого Дока с его будущей женой. Вот только есть одна проблема. Даже не так, есть три проблемы. Ей нравится, как Док выглядит в белом костюме, ей нравится его верность, ей нравится его гениальный ум и позиция в обществе идеального гражданина. Значит, стоит изменить её взгляды на идеального жениха и показать что он на самом деле не такой.  И все это нужно сделать до открытия выставки изобретений в Хилл-Вэлли. Используйте свою смекалку, невероятные изобретения Эммета, помощь своих родственников и конечно же легендарный DeLorean что бы добиться своей цели.

33609437.review:
Ne connaissant Retour vers le Futur que de nom, ce jeu aura été une bonne surprise pour moi. Evidemment,je n'ai donc pas pu apprécier les eventuels clins d'oeil à la saga ce qui ne m'aura malgré tout pas empêché d'apprécier le jeu à sa juste valeur. En effet, doublage anglais irréprochable, graphismes très soignés, animations très bonnes, scénario accrocheur, mise en scène prenante, les ingrédients sont là pour passer une bonne dizaine d'heures de plaisir !

Quelques reproches que l'on pourrait faire au titre cependant : les sous-titres pas toujours appropriés, ce qui empêche parfois le bon fonctionnement de certains effets (notamment l'humour). Ensuite, le jeu ressemble, il est vrai, plus à un film interactif qu'à un jeu à proprement dit, surtout que les quelques fois où l'on participe un peu, les énigmes ne sont pas bien compliquées. Au final, on passe donc les 3/4 du temps à parler aux personnages, à suivre les nombreux dialogues et à visiter les décors. Ca m'aura au moins permis de me familiariser un peu avec l'univers, comme quoi ce n'est pas spécialement un point négatif.

En bref, tous les ingrédients sont au rendez-vous et tous les domaines sont très soignés ce qui nous permet de passer un vrai bon moment tout au long des cinq épisodes. je le conseille donc autant aux fans de la série qu'à ceux qui, comme moi, ne connaissent que les grandes lignes de la saga. D'ailleurs, mieux vaut tard que jamais, ça m'a bien donné envie de voir la version cinéma... >> 15/20

32947246.review: Epizodyczna gra przygodowa oparta na motywach kultowej trylogii Roberta Zemeckisa Powrót do Przyszłości. Za powstanie gry odpowiada specjalizujące się w tym gatunku gier amerykańskie studio Telltale Games, znane z takich produkcji, jak cykl Sam & Max czy kilka odsłon detektywistycznej serii CSI. W grze śledzimy perypetie znanych z ekranu bohaterów: nastolatka Marty'ego McFlya i szalonego naukowca Emmetta Browna, a akcja gry rozpoczyna się 6 miesięcy po wydarzeniach znanych z trzeciej części filmu. Rozgrywka polega na eksplorowaniu kolejnych lokacji, prowadzeniu konwersacji, rozwiązywaniu zagadek i zbieraniu potrzebnych przedmiotów, a całość podzielona została na kilka niezależnych epizodów, udostępnianych graczom w regularnych odstępach czasu. Oprawa graficzna Back to the Future utrzymana została w barwnym, kreskówkowym stylu, a w warstwie dźwiękowej słyszymy m.in. głos samego Christophera Lloyda, czyli odtwórcy roli szalonego doktora.

32466816.review:
Note: I'm writing the same review for all 5 episodes, since they're basically just one game cut into 5 separate titles, instead of one single package.

Back to the Future: The Game is a good Telltale Games point-and-click adventure, especially if you're a fan of the franchise. There's a lot of references to the movies and in reality the whole game feels like another movie, which is good here. The story is good and well written, and the characters interesting with superb voice acting. There's a lot of comedy too. The puzzles are OK, not being too difficult. There's a great hint system if you need it, so you're never stuck for long. Since it's an older game, there's aren't choices to make here, but that wasn't a deal breaker, especially if you get it for cheap. The controls are a bit clunky though, and the framerate choppy.

32195188.review: Какой нехороший человек придумал вместо одной полноценной игры сделать 5 но мелконарезаных? Ужасно неудобно!

31930568.review:
NOTA: Este análisis es de todos los episodios en conjunto, y lo copiaré y pegaré en cada uno de ellos.

Por ser una de las primeras aventuras gráficas de Telltale, digamos, de primer nivel, presenta una diferencia fundamental con las aventuras mas modernas de esta desarrolladora, como The Walking Dead, Game of Thrones o Batman: NO HAY DECISIONES QUE ALTEREN LA HISTORIA,  el juego es totalmente lineal y solo hay una posible solución y desenlace de la historia. Esto no es necesariamente malo, simplemente distinto, si vas a jugarlo esperando otra cosa, probablemente te lleves una decepcion.

Dicho esto, el apartado gráfico del juego es Telltale 100%, graficos de estilo "dibujos animados", aunque con mucho menos Cel Shading (efecto comic, para que nos entendamos) que otros titulos. Para una aventura gráfica cumple sobradamente, pero sin duda los puntos fuertes del juego son la historia y la banda sonora, ambas, obviamente heredadas de la trilogía cinematográfica. Si eres un fan de la saga, como yo, disfrutaras la historia, si solo eres un fan de las historias de viajes en el tiempo, también, y si no eres ni de una ni de otra, también, aunque es altamente recomendable ver las peliculas, sobre todo para el principio, ya que, si no, nos descolocará ver la situacion de los personajes, y durante el juego, no entenderemos muchas referencias. Además, el juego tiene MUCHO fan service en este aspecto, con frases, expresiones, citas y referencias a las pelis y es una pena no cogerlas. Personalmente me da algo de rabia que justo en los ultimos compases del juego empiezan a aparecer "incongurencias" en la linea temporal, pero es algo que suele pasar cuando haces historias sobre vijes en el tiempo y paradojas temporales, que hacer que todo quede resuelto y explicado es algo complejo.

La jugabilidad no tiene mucho misterio, decir que es point & click, aunque se puede mover al personaje con WASD y que tiene puzzles interesantes, pero no esperes un Monkey Island o un Randal's Monday en dificultad. Esto es una aventura de Telltale y basicamente te cuenta una historia, no busca hacerte la vida imposible.

Como detalle final, que es algo muy comentado: El final. Es un final de fan service 200%, mal llevado, que hace más daño que otra cosa, pero no estropea el resto del juego. Son solo los ultimos 2 minutos.

Su mayor handicap es sin duda que solo está en ingles, lo que hara que muchos no puedan jugarlo, pero a parte de eso es un buen juego, sobre todo si eres fan.

NOTA FINAL: 7.5

31247262.review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a full review, and NOT a first impressions review 

ANOTHER DISCLAIMER: Back to the Future: The Game has five episodes which are split seperately and are downloaded one by one, thus reviews are more or less the same as the gameplay mechanics are basically the same in all five episodes. So please think before commenting about the similarity in the reviews [/h1]

Back to the Future: The Game is an episodic adventure game with five episodes, developed and published by Telltale Games, the same people behind other such great adventure games as The Wolf Among Us and Game of Thrones. The game is based on the film series of the same name

Although the game does not follow the same exact storyline as the first film, it follows the same universe as Back to the Future follows only seeing it in a different point of view

As mentioned previously, the game is split up into five episodes. The game works as a normal television series. Each length of an episode is roughly one hour long

The gameplay is very simple, you move around, selecting stuff and talking to people and using button prompts when told to. Choices don't really matter as to other Telltale Games

The game's graphics are okay for the most part however there are some ugly texture work here and there. The sound and music options also vary in quality. Sometimes the sound quality is really good and sometimes the sound quality is bad. I have encountered numerous amounts of glitches which seems as if Telltale Games never got round to fixing them, too many to mention in this review

Telltale's Back to the Future: The Game pays a good homage to the Back to the Future film series and is definitely better than Jurassic Park: The Game which is another Universal Pictures license

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

31087509.review:
This isn't so much an adventure game as an interactive story, but it's a good bit of fun and easy to enjoy. 

The puzzle solutions are sometimes quite unobvious, leaving you hovering the mouse over every conceivable object on the screen or simply using the hint system. That's not to say that this game is challenging by any means, on the whole it's fairly easy to breeze through each episode in one or maybe two sittings.

Fans of Back to the Future will love it. Fans of adventure games, you may want something a bit more challenging. Still a great purchase though, and easily a steam sale must-have.

30469594.review: Despite its faults, Back to the Future Episode 4 remains a pleasurable nostalgia trip for fans. Among other clever winks to the film series, Marty blasts a few people off their feet after hooking his guitar up to a car-sized speaker and rides around town on a makeshift skateboard. Like every episode before it, Double Vision ends with a twist, which helped build my excitement for Telltale's next (and final) entry, but I hope Episode 5 tries to break the mold.

30130970.review:
Почему стоит играть:
+ Новые приключения любимых героев.
+ Дока озвучивает всё тот же великолепный Кристофер Ллойд. А голос Марти хоть и не Майкл Дж. Фокса, но очень на него похож, потому воспринимается как родной. Озвучка других героев так же не подкачала.
+ Добротные головоломки.

Почему не стоит играть:
- Полностью провальная история. Элемент, который был просто великолепным в фильме, и который крайне важен в играх подобного жанра, получился крайне посредственным. Сюжетные дыры образуются на каждом сюжетном повороте. Авторы вообще забыли про хоть какую-то логику и идеи из фильма. В результате из научной фантастики история скатилась до бабушкиной сказки. Чего только стоит объяснение возвращения делориана.
- Однообразие. Почти всё действие в игре происходит между 1986 и 1931 годах на одной и той же локации с небольшими ответвлениями. Хоть что-то интересное начинает происходить только в третьем эпизоде, но потом опять скатывается на унылый 31-ый год.
- Абсолютно неуместное камео Майкл Дж. Фокса в пятом эпизоде. Оно вызывает не радость, а недоразумение и вопрос "Что это было?". Настолько нелепо вписать персонажа нужно ещё постараться.

Игра паразитирует на ностальгии. Не будь за её плечами великолепных трёх частей фильма, она прошла бы незаметной. Как самостоятельное произведение она никчёмна. Но как творение, расширяющее полюбившуюся вселенную и дарящую новую встречу с Марти и Доком, очень даже хорошо. В неё стоит поиграть хотя бы ради третьего эпизода.

29716688.review:
For fans of the movies, there really isn't much of a choice other than to play this series. "Back to the Future: The Game" is one of TellTale's earlier games, and it shows, with very limited choices and a linear story. The story itself also hews close to the original trilogy, down to the same feel when it comes to the final resolution.

Voice acting isn't bad. Christopher Lloyd is around to voice Doc Brown, and Michael J. Fox makes a cameo near the end. They got other voice actors to play everyone else (including Marty McFly and the various Biffs), but they do a decent job. The music is great, right out of the movies. To be honest, if you go into this game expecting to be playing the movie (or an episode of the animated series), you'll know what you're in for.

I really enjoyed this series back when it first came out, but it isn't as good as TellTale's later attempts.

29657267.review: This alternate Doc thing would have been a lot better if they were more bold with it. I just can't help thinking of Comstock.

29629342.review: После событий фильма «Назад в будущее 3», Док Эмметт Браун обосновался вместе со своей семьёй в городке Хилл-Вэлли. На дворе 1991 год, доктор Эмметт Браун восстановил ДэЛориан после крушения, потому что он удобней для путешествий во времени, чем Паровоз Времени, которым, тем не менее, Брауны и Марти также часто пользуются. Все герои живут своей жизнью и подчас сталкиваются с обыденными сложностями. В эти моменты в их жизни начинает участвовать время, что преподносит Марти и семье Дока самые удивительные приключения.

28273537.review:
[h1]Short version: 71%[/h1]
The fourth episode sits in an uncomfortable place, since it both serves as a conclusion to the third and a prologue to the fifth, instead of being something that could stand on its own. At least this orphaned status helps to integrate the gameplay more naturally into the plot.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
The last episode ended with more than a cliffhanger, as it was obvious that a good chunk of the story set in the alternate (80s) present Hill Valley were left untold. This is where ‘Double Visions’ picks off, as we guide Marty through a citizen correction (meaning: brainwashing) center to rescue Emmett Brown, Marty’s only ticket back to the past he needs to correct (again).

Thing is, by the time we reach the end of this ordeal, the episode arrives in the uncomfortable state of not having enough material for a new standalone storyline, so we immediately start to prepare ourselves for the big fireworks in the season finale. Everything we do back in 1930’s Hill Valley is nothing more than a long attempt to convince young Emmet to participate in a science fair, which is quite obviously set up as the big event of this game series.
To do so, we do what we did in the past two chapters: lots and lots of barely-connected subtasks, which all serve the goal of driving a wedge between Emmett and Edna. The more light-hearted writing helps to make the episode more fun, but like the previous time, players will most likely just want to jump right to the next one to see some actual content.

24995777.review:
As in TellTale Monkey Island, I'll wite the same review for each episodes since they're all part of the same game.

Speaking of Monkey Island, this game plays about the same (not like the newer ones, walking dead and Games of Thrones).  It's funny and has a good story that stays true to the Back to the Future movies.  I couldn't not help myself to push the hint button a few times because some puzzles were challenging.

I had a good laugh a few times and could't help smilling when I saw the overboard in last episode !  The music is also good, glad they used the same as the movies.

24969302.review: Returning back to 1931 is not making the 4th episode anything special, without gangsters it seem little boring although you get to ruin love life of others which is always fun.

24739918.review:
[h1]Was travelling through time:[b]Wing[/b][/h1]
One basic thing, I've never watched a [i]Back to the Future[/i] movie, so I can only think that game is based on a film.
[i]Back to the Future[/i] is point-&-click game made by [u]Telltale Games[/u], as we all know, it must be episodic, game itself has 5 episodes that were released from [b]22 December 2010 to 23 June 2011[/b]. Game action takes place in fictional city [i]Hill Valley[/i]. Here's the list of episodes and short description of what is going in them([u]I will try to include as little amount of spoilers as I can[/u])[olist]
[*][b]It's About Time[/b] - We begin game in 1986, but when we find out our best friend is missing, we are looking for him, after that, we are going back in time to 1931 to rescue our friend! 
[*][b]Get Tannen![/b] - When everything seems ok, our friend finds out that our grandfather is going to die and we need to rescue him AND make the most dangerous criminal in Hill Valley, will go to jail!
[*][b]Citizen Brown[/b] - Everything looks fixed, everyone is happy (except that one guy in jail), but then! We are transported to [i]Future Hill Valley[/i] or [i]Pure Hill Valley[/i] or, as I prefer to say [i]Alternate Hill Valley[/i]. In this episode we need to make problems in [i]Pure Hill Valley[/i] to meet [u]Citizen Brown[/u] and convince that HIS [i]Hill Valley[/i] is bad and people are unhappy!
[*][b]Double Visions[/b] - After rescuing [u]Citizen Brown[/u] and destroying his ideal vision of sad [i]Hill Valley[/i] we need to rescue him again from his enraged wife, then go back in time to 1931 to find his younger self and convince him to break up with his future wife, after that is done, episode ends.
[*][b]OUTATIME![/b] - We are still in 1931 and we must find Younger Brown [spoiler]his older self kidnapped him[/spoiler] and then we must take care that Younger one, will do his presentation at Science Expo. After that, everything seems ok, but then! The Woman who broke with Brown, stole his DeLorean and went back in time, and we need to find out to what date she travelled, after that, we are going to 19th Century to stop arson of the Saloon and in consequence, destruction of whole[i]Hill Valley[/i]. In the end, we must manipulate with stolen DeLorean and then make sure that she'll land in 1931... And in the end is kinda funny plot twist but discover it by yourself :)[/olist]
And now's time for few most important characters:[list]
[*][i]Marty McFly[/i] - Main protagonist, time traveler, also known as [i]Sonny Crockett, Yakov Smirnoff[/i]
[*][i]Emmett 'Doc' Brown [/i] - Best friend of Marty, time traveler, inventor, also known as [i]Carl Sagan - The Infamous Arsonist[/i]
[*][i]Edna Strickland[/i] - And here are 2:
 - [i]Young Edna[/i] - Cute, manipulating, desiring power and control over people [spoiler]She's the real arsonist[/spoiler]
 - [i]Old Edna[/i] - Alone, miserable, spends days on yelling
[*][i]Biff Tannen[/i] - Typical bully, in the right timeline he works for Marty's father.
[*][i]Arthur McFly[/i] - Only seen in 1931, our Grandfather, he makes kinda big role in Marty adventure
[*][i]Kid Tannen[/i] - The most dangerous gangster in 1931, he needs to be arrested (Episode 2)
[*][i]Einstein[/i] - Our cute and lovely dog <3 
[*][i]Citizen Brown also known as Alternate Emmett[/i] - He thinks that HIS [i]Hill Valley[/i] is perfect, we need to convince him that this city is Town of fear
[*][i]Citizen Edna also known as Alternate Old Edna[/i] - Manipulates with [i]Alternate Emmett[/i], after Marty destroys her husband's vision of perfect city, she tries to manipulate with his memory
[*][i]Young Emmett[/i] - Young inventor, feared of his dad, in sick love with Edna
[*][i]Trixie Trotter also known as 'Sylvia'[/i] - Our (unknowingly until end of game) Grandmother, speakeasy stage performer, cute[/list]
Let's see how it looks...
[b]Gameplay - 8/10[/b] - Typical point-&-click, with annoying camera sometimes, yet still, gameplay is great
[b]Audio - 6/10[/b] - Not bad, not good, decent, BUT with soundtrack from movie I think
[b]Graphics - 8/10[/b] - Nice, clear, not-eye hurting, except characters sometimes look like dead (I mean, without emotions)
[b]Story - 10/10[/b] - Great! Just Great!

[h1]OVERALL - 8/10[/h1] - [i]Game itself has a few bugs here and there, and sometimes can be harder or easier, but this is one, great, funny story with lovely characters and with unfortunately decent audio, I can recommend it for fans of point-&-click or Telltale Games lovers[/i]

[u][b]Greetings, Wing[/b][/u]

24640678.review: [b]I only recommend this game on sale to fans of the BTTF movies[/b]. It is a a bare bones point & click linear adventure game with many mildly infuriating components, but the story is a faithful 5 episode sequel to the BTTF movies. You play as Marty McFly in 1985 which starts with an homage to the first movie, but takes place after the 3 movies.  I did enjoy this fourth episode, which fit just fine within the greater story.

24552020.review:
Прекрасная игра из тех времён, когда Telltale ещё не скатилась и делала прекрасные адвенчуры. "Назад в Будущее" сочетает в себе приятную графику, зрелищные и интересные катсцены и кинцо, но в тоже время в игре осталось место квесту, задачкам и интересным головоломкам. Это настоящая современная адвенчура такая, какая она могла бы быть в наше время. Да ещё и по любимым фильмам)

Четвертый эпизод для меня один из самых лучших, где проходит выставка и нужно поставить Дока на пусть истинный) Головоломки тут просто шикарные, особенно у Дока дома. Очень хороший эпизод)

24481280.review:
[h1] ⚜ Zusammenfassung: [/h1]

Wir haben es wieder einmal geschafft die Zeitachse in der Vergangenheit zu richten, aber dieses Mal scheint Doc nicht ganz so glücklich mit Marty's Entscheidung Edna von ihm zu trennen, obwohl ihm bewusst ist das seine Beziehung zu ihr in eine Diktatur-Stadt führen wird. 


[+]
● eine Geschichte die zwar auf 'Back to the Future' beruht jedoch keine nach Erzählung darstellt
● schöne Vertonung/Synchronisation
● wie immer packender Erzählstil der Telltale - Games
● es gibt Tipps zur Hilfestellung
● witzige Dialoge

[-]
● ältere Grafik


[h1] ⚜ Fazit: [/h1]

⇨ folgt in Episode 5

24472408.review: The best episode thus far.  The writers did a great job with the characters in this one.  It's hard to go over specifics without spoiling it.  What I can say is that I'm glad I played through to this point.  Now I have just one episode to go.

24273398.review: Back to the Future: The Game - игра сиквел по мотивам трилогии Роберта Земекиса "Back to the Future". Достойное продолжение истории доктора Эмметта Брауна и его спутника Марти Макфлая. Игра полна отсылками к оригинальной трилогии и пропитана той самой атмосферой прошлого, настоящего и будущего. Огромное спасибо разработчикам из Telltale Games за великолепный сюжет и полученное удовольствие при прохождении игры.

24070420.review:

This game is once again wonderfully built and I loved it.
